title: Watching the Australian Open Tennis on the BBC
summary: The Australian Open is a big tennis tournament in Melbourne, Australia, starting on January 18 and ending on February 1. You can watch and listen to it on the BBC. Players like Jannik Sinner, who won last year, and Madison Keys are trying to win again. Other top players like Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic are also playing. The BBC has live radio commentary on BBC Radio 5 Live, BBC Sounds, and BBC iPlayer. There is also a show called Tennis Breakfast every morning for fun talk about the games. This helps fans follow all the exciting matches from home.

background_read: The Australian Open is one of the four major tennis tournaments in the world, called Grand Slams. It happens every year in Melbourne, Australia, and attracts top players from around the globe. The BBC is a broadcaster in the UK that provides sports coverage, including tennis, so people can enjoy games from home. Understanding basic terms like 'commentary' helps fans follow along easily.
